alert.note: Alert for Williamson (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 24 at 10:37AM CST until further notice by NWS Nashville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Nashville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Tennessee... Harpeth River Below Franklin affecting Williamson County. For the Harpeth River...including Franklin...elevated river levels are forecast. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Harpeth River Below Franklin. * WHEN...From this morning until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Water begins to inundate low lying areas along the banks, including the nursery at Hillsboro Road and Fulton Green Lane. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:00 AM CST Thursday the stage was 22.3 feet and rising. - Forecast...No forecast is available for this location. - Action stage is 22.0 feet. - Flood stage is 27.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 445 AM CST.
